body:
### Problem

Imagine you have `~/dotfiles` as a directory. Then inside of that you have `~/dotfiles/.config/nvim` which houses all of your Neovim config files. This is a symlink source which is then symlinked to `~/.config/nvim` as the destination.

Currently if you `nvim .` from within `~/dotfiles` and open any Lua file in `.config/nvim` (relative and still inside the dotfiles repo) with the LSP enabled, the `root_spec` gets changed to `~/.config/nvim` and now other tools that depend on this will think you're in `~/.config/nvim`.

It's like it's following a symlink source to the destination and using that as the new path when you're really still operating on local files in `~/dotfiles`. This is the part that feels like strange behavior since it's a source directory.

It's worth pointing out if you open a non-Lua file which has no LSP enabled in the same directory, then the issue does not occur.

**Edit:** I recently came across `:LspInfo` after recording the video below. The Lua LSP shows the `root_directory` being modified to `~/dotfiles/.config/nvim/` but the BashLS LSP does not modify it, it remains at `~/dotfiles`. Perhaps that indicates the issue is specific to the Lua LSP and not Neovim itself?

### Steps to reproduce using "nvim -u minimal_init.lua"

I really apologize. I don't know how to reproduce this with an isolated Lua example. I reported a similar issue to a specific plugin but they mentioned it's an issue with how the LSP itself is operating.

I've recorded a video of it here (with audio):

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1920b172-e8dc-4972-ac05-00f3e3bb4611

You can also try it out on your own:

You can repeat this with my dotfiles at https://github.com/nickjj/dotfiles, there's a section half way down in the readme file showing how to install them in a Docker container so you can try it out without polluting your system. A single install script will install everything and set up the symlinks.

Then in the container you can:

- `cd ~/dotfiles`
- `nvim .`
- Open `.config/nvim/lua/config/options.lua`
- Hit `<leader>/` to open live grep
- Search for `set-theme` and it won't show up (this file is in `.local/bin`).

### Expected behavior

The root path is not changed.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

v0.10.4

### Language server name/version

Lua 3.13.6 (obtained from `:LazyHealth`)

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 22.04

### Log file

_No response_
title: LSP: Potential issue with setting root_spec when dealing with symlink sources
